A simple package for parsing command line arguments with basic functionality. This is intended for quick arg parsing with minimum dependencies, for more complex scenarios, see alternatives like the argparse package.

Types

ParsedValues = object
  args: seq[string]
  opts: Table[string, string]
  flags: Table[string, bool]

ParseSchema = object
  main_name: string
  options: Table[ArgNames, ArgDefinition]

Procs

proc `[]`(p: ParsedValues; y: int): string {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
Return the Nth value from positional arguments as string. Raise IndexDefect if index out of bounds 
proc `[]`(p: ParsedValues; y: string): string {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Return the corresponding value from parsed arguments as string or empty string if not found 
proc addFlag(args: var ParseSchema; short: string = ""; long: string = "";
             help: string = "") {.discardable, ...raises: [ValueError, KeyError],
                                  tags: [].}
Add a flag to command line args. This is a parameter that do not expect value and return true when set 
proc addOption(args: var ParseSchema; short: string = ""; long: string = "";
               required: bool = false; default: string = ""; help: string = "";
               choices: seq[string] = @[]) {.discardable,
    ...raises: [ValueError, KeyError], tags: [].}
Add an option to command line args. This is a parameter that expects a value 
proc getArgs(p: ParsedValues): seq[string] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Return all positional arguments as a seq of strings 
proc getOpt[T](p: ParsedValues; y: string; x: var T) {.discardable.}
Read args value and return a value of the desired type. X can be a var of type str, int, float or bool 
proc isSet(p: ParsedValues; y: string): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Return true when the y argument was set at command line 
proc keys(p: ParsedValues): seq[string] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Return all keys from parsed arguments as a seq of strings 
proc parseOptions(args: var ParseSchema; cmdline: string = ""): ParsedValues {.
    ...raises: [ValueError, KeyError], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Parse the values from the command line according tot the parse schema 
proc printHelp(args: ParseSchema) {.discardable, ...raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
Print help message according to the parse schema and exit

Iterators

iterator pairs(p: ParsedValues): (string, string) {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Convenience iterator to iterate over all parsed arguments as (key, value) pairs

Templates

template initParser(p: var ParseSchema; title: string = ""; body: untyped): untyped
Create a new parser
